alert.note: Alert for Austin; Colorado; Fort Bend; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 4:29PM CDT until May 18 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Fort Bend, Austin, Wharton and Colorado Counties. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Boling...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Bernard River Near East Bernard. * WHEN...Until Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins in the vicinity of the gage with minor roads along the river inundated. Backwater flooding up Britt Branch and Bratcher Slough begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.1 feet on 10/18/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu San Bernard River East Bernard 17.0 17.0 Mon 3 am CDT 19.3 17.5 16.2 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 430 AM CDT.
